messages.content: What is the recommended alternative to Masquerade Nodes for dealing with masks and segmentation in ComfyUI?
The recommended alternative to Masquerade Nodes for dealing with masks and segmentation in ComfyUI is the Impact Pack.
What does the 'Mask by Text' node in Masquerade Nodes do?
The 'Mask by Text' node in Masquerade Nodes makes use of ClipSeg to dynamically create masks from images via text prompts.
What are the four example workflows enabled by the Masquerade Nodes pack?

The four example workflows enabled by the Masquerade Nodes pack are: 1) Fine control over composition via automatic photobashing, 2) Inpaint all faces at a higher resolution, 3) Inpaint all buildings with a particular LORA, and 4) Filtering out images or changing save location of images that contain certain objects/concepts without the side-effects caused by placing those concepts in a negative prompt.
What are the two main inputs for the 'Mask by Text' node?

The two main inputs for the 'Mask by Text' node are 'prompt', which is one or more prompts to select separated by the | symbol, and 'negative_prompt', which is zero or more prompts to select separated by the | symbol.
What does the 'Mask To Region' node in Masquerade Nodes do?
The 'Mask To Region' node in Masquerade Nodes is used to calculate a region around a mask, often used to select a reasonable area around the masked area for inpainting at full resolution.
What is the purpose of the 'Cut By Mask' node?
The 'Cut By Mask' node is used to cut the masked area out of an image or mask.
What does the 'Create QR Code' node do?
The 'Create QR Code' node generates a QR code based on the provided text input, with customizable size, version, error correction, box size, and border.
